name: Afghanistan
knownEvent: Soviet invasion 1979, US invasion 2001, Taliban takeover 2021
viralFact: Taliban retook control in August 2021 after US withdrawal â€” one of the most-watched news events of the decade
info: Afghanistan is a landlocked Central Asian country known for the Hindu Kush mountains, ancient Silk Road history, and decades of conflict that culminated in the Taliban retaking power in 2021.

name: Albania
knownEvent: Communist isolation under Enver Hoxha, mass emigration to Italy 1991
viralFact: Albania has over 170,000 concrete bunkers built during Communist rule â€” more bunkers per square km than any country on Earth
info: Albania is a small Balkan nation on the Adriatic coast, famous for its 170,000+ Communist-era bunkers, and the birthplace of Mother Teresa. It has NATO membership but is not yet an EU member.

name: Algeria
knownEvent: Independence from France 1962, Civil war 1990s
viralFact: Algeria is Africa's largest country by area â€” larger than Western Europe combined
info: Algeria is Africa's largest country, mostly covered by the Sahara Desert. It gained independence from France in 1962 after a brutal eight-year war and is a major oil and gas producer.

name: Angola
knownEvent: Civil war 1975-2002 â€” one of Africa's longest civil wars
viralFact: Angola had one of the world's worst landmine problems after its 27-year civil war, with millions of uncleared mines
info: Angola is a large Central African nation and major oil producer that endured a devastating 27-year civil war after independence from Portugal in 1975. Portuguese is the official language.

name: Argentina
knownEvent: Falklands War 1982, Won FIFA World Cup 2022 (Qatar)
viralFact: Lionel Messi finally won the FIFA World Cup in 2022 in Qatar â€” one of the most emotional sporting moments of the decade
info: Argentina is South America's second-largest country, famous for football legend Lionel Messi, tango, Patagonia, and winning the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar. Borders Chile along the Andes.

name: Australia
landmark: Great Barrier Reef, Sydney Opera House, Uluru
knownEvent: 2019-2020 Black Summer bushfires, Sydney 2000 Olympics
viralFact: Australia's 2019-2020 Black Summer bushfires burned over 18 million hectares and killed an estimated 3 billion animals â€” the largest wildlife disaster in modern history
info: Australia is the world's sixth-largest country and a continent unto itself. Famous for unique wildlife, the Great Barrier Reef, and the catastrophic 2019-2020 Black Summer bushfires that shocked the world.

name: Austria
knownEvent: Birthplace of Mozart and Hitler, Habsburg Empire capital
viralFact: Vienna has been voted the world's most liveable city multiple times â€” Austria's capital consistently tops global quality of life rankings
info: Austria is a landlocked Central European country famous for Mozart, classical music, the Alps, and Vienna â€” consistently ranked the world's most liveable city. EU member but not NATO.

name: Azerbaijan
landmark: Flame Towers Baku, Gobustan mud volcanoes
knownEvent: Nagorno-Karabakh war with Armenia 2020, Eurovision host 2012
viralFact: Azerbaijan won the 2020 Nagorno-Karabakh war in 44 days using Turkish drones â€” a turning point in modern drone warfare
info: Azerbaijan is a Caucasus country on the Caspian Sea, known for its oil wealth, the Flame Towers of Baku, and winning the 44-day 2020 war with Armenia over Nagorno-Karabakh using drone warfare.

name: Bahamas
knownEvent: Hurricane Dorian 2019 â€” most powerful Atlantic hurricane to hit land
viralFact: Hurricane Dorian stalled over the Bahamas in 2019 for 24 hours with 300km/h winds â€” one of the most destructive storms ever recorded
info: The Bahamas is a Caribbean island nation northeast of Cuba, known for stunning pink sand beaches, turquoise waters, and being devastated by Hurricane Dorian in 2019.

name: Bahrain
knownEvent: Arab Spring protests 2011, hosts F1 Grand Prix
viralFact: Bahrain is the smallest country in the Middle East and the first Gulf state to discover oil, yet has nearly run out â€” now pivoting to finance and tourism
info: Bahrain is a tiny island kingdom in the Persian Gulf, one of the most liberal Gulf states, home to the Formula 1 Bahrain Grand Prix and the first Gulf country to discover oil.

name: Bangladesh
knownEvent: 1971 Liberation War, 2024 Student Revolution toppled Sheikh Hasina
viralFact: In July-August 2024, Bangladeshi students led a mass uprising that toppled Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina after 15 years â€” she fled to India by helicopter. One of the most dramatic political events of 2024.
historicFact: The 1971 Bangladesh Liberation War saw 3 million killed in one of the 20th century's worst genocides, with India helping Bangladesh gain independence from Pakistan
info: Bangladesh is a densely populated South Asian delta nation, home to 170 million people, the Sundarbans mangrove forest, and Cox's Bazar â€” the world's longest natural sea beach. In 2024, a student-led revolution toppled the government.

name: Belgium
landmark: Atomium, Grand Place Brussels, Manneken Pis
knownEvent: WWI and WWII battleground, NATO headquarters, EU capital
viralFact: Brussels hosts both NATO headquarters and the European Union's main institutions â€” making it effectively the political capital of the Western world
info: Belgium is a small Western European nation that is home to NATO and EU headquarters, famous for chocolate, waffles, and being the crossroads of European politics and WWII history.

name: Bolivia
knownEvent: Bolivian coup 2019, world's largest lithium reserves discovered
viralFact: Bolivia holds the world's largest lithium reserves â€” the key metal in electric vehicle batteries â€” making it a crucial player in the green energy revolution
info: Bolivia is a landlocked South American country home to the world's largest salt flat (Salar de Uyuni) and the world's largest lithium reserves. La Paz is the world's highest capital city.

name: Bosnia and Herzegovina
landmark: Stari Most bridge Mostar, Sarajevo Old Town
knownEvent: Siege of Sarajevo 1992-1996 (longest siege in modern warfare), Srebrenica genocide 1995
viralFact: The Siege of Sarajevo (1992-1996) lasted 1,425 days â€” the longest siege of a capital city in the history of modern warfare
info: Bosnia and Herzegovina is a Balkan nation scarred by the 1990s Yugoslav Wars, including the 1,425-day Siege of Sarajevo and the Srebrenica genocide. It hosted the 1984 Winter Olympics.

name: Brazil
landmark: Christ the Redeemer, Amazon River, Iguazu Falls
knownEvent: Rio 2016 Olympics, 2014 World Cup 7-1 loss to Germany, Amazon deforestation crisis
viralFact: Brazil's 7-1 loss to Germany in the 2014 World Cup semifinal on home soil â€” dubbed 'Mineirazo' â€” is considered the most shocking result in football history
info: Brazil is South America's largest country, home to the Amazon rainforest, Christ the Redeemer, and 5 World Cup titles. The 2014 World Cup 7-1 semifinal loss to Germany on home soil remains football's greatest shock.

name: Brunei
knownEvent: Sultan Hassanal Bolkiah â€” one of world's wealthiest rulers, sharia law introduced 2019
viralFact: Brunei's Sultan owns over 7,000 cars including 600 Rolls-Royces â€” his 1996 birthday party cost $30 million and featured Michael Jackson performing
info: Brunei is a tiny oil-rich sultanate on the island of Borneo, ruled by one of the world's wealthiest monarchs. It introduced sharia law in 2019 and has one of the highest GDPs per capita in Asia.

name: Cambodia
knownEvent: Khmer Rouge genocide 1975-1979, up to 2 million killed
viralFact: Angkor Wat is the world's largest religious monument â€” so iconic it appears on Cambodia's national flag, the only country to feature a building on its flag
info: Cambodia is Southeast Asia home to Angkor Wat â€” the world's largest religious monument that appears on its national flag. The country suffered the Khmer Rouge genocide (1975-1979) that killed up to 2 million people.

name: Cameroon
knownEvent: Roger Milla 1990 World Cup hero, Africa Cup of Nations host 2022
viralFact: Cameroon is called 'Africa in miniature' because it contains almost every climate and landscape found on the African continent â€” from beaches to rainforests to deserts
info: Cameroon is called 'Africa in miniature' for its extraordinary landscape diversity. Famous for its indomitable Lions football team, including Roger Milla's iconic 1990 World Cup celebrations.

name: Canada
knownEvent: 2010 Vancouver Olympics, Trudeau government, wildfire evacuations 2023
viralFact: Canada's 2023 wildfire season was the worst in recorded history â€” over 18 million hectares burned, forcing the evacuation of entire cities including Yellowknife
info: Canada is the world's second-largest country by area, famous for maple syrup, ice hockey, Niagara Falls, and its vast wilderness. Its 2023 wildfires were the worst ever recorded globally.

name: Chile
knownEvent: 2010 CopiapÃ³ mining accident â€” 33 miners rescued after 69 days underground
viralFact: The 2010 Chile mine rescue â€” 33 miners survived 69 days underground in the Atacama Desert â€” was watched live by over 1 billion people worldwide
info: Chile is a long, narrow South American country stretching along the Pacific coast. Home to the Atacama Desert (world's driest), Easter Island, and the dramatic 2010 mine rescue watched by a billion people.

name: China
landmark: Great Wall, Forbidden City, Terracotta Army
knownEvent: COVID-19 origin 2019, Beijing 2008 Olympics, Tiananmen Square 1989
viralFact: COVID-19 first emerged in Wuhan, China in late 2019 â€” leading to a global pandemic that killed over 7 million people and changed the world forever
info: China is the world's most populous nation and second-largest economy, home to the Great Wall, Forbidden City, and the source of COVID-19 pandemic in 2019. Communist Party has governed since 1949.

name: Colombia
knownEvent: Pablo Escobar and MedellÃ­n cartel, 2016 Peace Nobel Prize, FARC peace deal
viralFact: Colombia's Pablo Escobar was the world's most wanted criminal â€” at his peak he was making $420 million per week and appeared on Forbes' billionaires list
info: Colombia is South America's northwest gateway, famous for coffee, Gabriel GarcÃ­a MÃ¡rquez, and its dark history with Pablo Escobar. The only country in South America with coastlines on both the Pacific and Atlantic.

name: Costa Rica
knownEvent: Abolished its military in 1948, 2022 World Cup quarterfinals
viralFact: Costa Rica abolished its military in 1948 and redirected funds to education and healthcare â€” it's one of the few countries in the world with no army
info: Costa Rica is a Central American country famous for abolishing its military in 1948, extraordinary biodiversity, and running on nearly 100% renewable energy. Considered one of the happiest countries.

name: Croatia
knownEvent: Yugoslavia breakup war 1991, 2018 World Cup finalist
viralFact: Dubrovnik's Old City was used as King's Landing in Game of Thrones â€” tourism tripled overnight and caused an 'overtourism' crisis
info: Croatia is a Adriatic Balkan nation famous for Dubrovnik (used as King's Landing in Game of Thrones), reaching the 2018 World Cup final, and joining the EU and NATO after Yugoslav breakup.

name: Cuba
knownEvent: Cuban Missile Crisis 1962, Castro revolution 1959, US embargo
viralFact: The Cuban Missile Crisis in 1962 brought the world closer to nuclear war than any other moment in history â€” the 13 days that nearly ended civilization
info: Cuba is a Caribbean island nation under Communist rule since Fidel Castro's 1959 revolution. Famous for the Cuban Missile Crisis, classic cars, cigars, and a US embargo lasting over 60 years.

name: Cyprus
knownEvent: Turkey invaded northern Cyprus 1974, island divided ever since
viralFact: Nicosia is the world's last divided capital city â€” a UN buffer zone called the 'Green Line' splits Cyprus between Greek and Turkish sides since 1974
info: Cyprus is a Mediterranean island EU member home to the mythological birthplace of Aphrodite. Nicosia remains the world's last divided capital, split since Turkey's 1974 invasion.

name: Czech Republic
knownEvent: Velvet Revolution 1989, Czechoslovakia split 1993
viralFact: The Czech Republic has the highest beer consumption per capita in the world â€” Czechs drink an average of 142 litres of beer per person per year
info: The Czech Republic (Czechia) is a landlocked Central European nation with the world's highest beer consumption per capita. Prague is one of Europe's best-preserved medieval cities.

name: Denmark
landmark: Little Mermaid statue Copenhagen, Tivoli Gardens
knownEvent: Invented LEGO, consistently happiest country rankings, Greenland controversy 2024
viralFact: Donald Trump's 2024 threat to 'take' Greenland from Denmark went globally viral â€” Greenland is an autonomous Danish territory and the world's largest island
info: Denmark is a Scandinavian monarchy famous for LEGO, being consistently ranked the world's happiest country, and owning Greenland â€” the world's largest island that sparked global controversy when Trump threatened to acquire it in 2024.

name: Ecuador
knownEvent: Galapagos inspired Darwin's evolution theory, presidential assassination attempt 2024
viralFact: Ecuador's President Noboa declared war on drug cartels in 2024 â€” gangs stormed a live TV broadcast with guns, shocking the world
info: Ecuador sits on the equator (its name means 'equator') and owns the Galapagos Islands that inspired Darwin's theory of evolution. In 2024 drug cartels stormed a live TV studio in a shocking attack.

name: Egypt
landmark: Pyramids of Giza, Sphinx, Nile River, Suez Canal
knownEvent: Arab Spring 2011, Suez Canal blocked by Ever Given ship 2021
viralFact: In 2021 the cargo ship Ever Given got stuck sideways in the Suez Canal for 6 days, blocking 12% of world trade and costing $9.6 billion per day â€” it became a global meme
info: Egypt is the cradle of civilization, home to the only surviving Ancient Wonder â€” the Great Pyramid of Giza. The Suez Canal runs through it, and its blockage in 2021 caused a global trade crisis.

name: Estonia
knownEvent: First country to declare internet access a human right, Skype founded here
viralFact: Estonia is the world's most digitally advanced country â€” citizens vote online, file taxes in 3 minutes, and almost everything is done digitally. Skype was invented here.
info: Estonia is a tiny Baltic EU and NATO member famous as the world's most digitally advanced country. Skype was invented here, and citizens can vote, pay taxes, and access all government services online.

name: Ethiopia
knownEvent: Birthplace of coffee, Tigray civil war 2020-2022, PM Abiy Ahmed Nobel Peace Prize 2019
viralFact: Coffee was discovered in Ethiopia â€” a goat herder named Kaldi noticed his goats became energetic after eating coffee berries, leading to one of the world's most consumed beverages
info: Ethiopia is the birthplace of coffee and humanity's oldest ancestors. The only African nation never colonized â€” it defeated Italy in 1896. Its PM won the 2019 Nobel Peace Prize before a devastating civil war erupted in 2020.

name: Finland
landmark: Northern Lights, Santa Claus Village Rovaniemi
knownEvent: Joined NATO 2023 ending 75 years of neutrality, consistently happiest country, Nokia birthplace
viralFact: Finland joined NATO in April 2023 â€” ending 75 years of military neutrality â€” as a direct response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. It shares an 1,340 km border with Russia.
info: Finland is a Scandinavian nation with 188,000 lakes, the Northern Lights, and Santa Claus's official hometown. It joined NATO in 2023, ending decades of neutrality due to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

name: France
landmark: Eiffel Tower, Louvre Museum, Palace of Versailles
knownEvent: Paris 2024 Olympics, Notre Dame fire 2019, Yellow Vest protests, French Revolution
viralFact: Notre Dame Cathedral burned in April 2019 â€” the world watched in horror as the spire collapsed. It was rebuilt and reopened in December 2024 to global celebration.
info: France is Western Europe's largest country, home to the Eiffel Tower, Louvre, and the most visited country on Earth. Notre Dame burned in 2019 and was spectacularly rebuilt for the 2024 Paris Olympics.

name: Georgia
landmark: Caucasus Mountains, ancient cave city Vardzia
knownEvent: Russia-Georgia war 2008, birthplace of Stalin, 2024 pro-EU protests
viralFact: Georgia is considered the birthplace of wine â€” 8,000-year-old wine residue found in clay pots here is the oldest evidence of winemaking in human history
info: Georgia is a Caucasus country considered the birthplace of wine (8,000 years of winemaking). Joseph Stalin was born here. It has a unique script unlike any other language and fought Russia in a 2008 war.

name: Germany
landmark: Brandenburg Gate, Neuschwanstein Castle, Berlin Wall remnants
knownEvent: Berlin Wall fell 1989, WWII, 2014 World Cup winners, beat Brazil 7-1
viralFact: Germany beat Brazil 7-1 in the 2014 World Cup semifinal on Brazilian soil â€” Miroslav Klose became the all-time World Cup top scorer in that match
info: Germany is Europe's largest economy, home to BMW, Volkswagen, Oktoberfest, and Beethoven. The Berlin Wall's fall in 1989 ended the Cold War, and Germany famously beat Brazil 7-1 on home soil at the 2014 World Cup.

name: Ghana
knownEvent: First sub-Saharan African country to gain independence 1957, Kwame Nkrumah, viral 'coffin dance' meme
viralFact: Ghana's 'coffin dancers' â€” pallbearers who dance joyfully at funerals â€” became the world's most viral meme in 2020, appearing in countless COVID death montages
info: Ghana was the first sub-Saharan African country to gain independence (1957), leading Pan-African movements. Famous for cocoa/chocolate production, and the globally viral 'coffin dance' funeral meme from 2020.

name: Greece
knownEvent: Invented democracy and Olympics, 2010 debt crisis, birthplace of Western civilization
viralFact: Greece invented democracy, the Olympics, philosophy, and much of Western civilization â€” yet went nearly bankrupt in 2010 requiring the largest financial bailout in history
info: Greece is the cradle of Western civilization â€” birthplace of democracy, the Olympics, and philosophy. Home to the Acropolis, Santorini, and the site of a historic 2010 debt crisis that shook the Eurozone.

name: Hungary
landmark: Budapest Parliament, Buda Castle, thermal baths
knownEvent: 1956 revolution against Soviet rule, Rubik's Cube invented here, Orban government
viralFact: The Rubik's Cube was invented by Hungarian architect ErnÅ‘ Rubik in 1974 â€” it became the world's best-selling toy with over 450 million sold
info: Hungary is a landlocked Central European EU member, birthplace of the Rubik's Cube and numerous Nobel laureates. Budapest is split by the Danube River and famous for its thermal bath culture.

name: Iceland
knownEvent: 2010 Eyjafjallajokull volcano disrupted all European flights, smallest nation to reach UEFA Euro quarterfinal 2016
viralFact: Iceland's 2010 volcano eruption (Eyjafjallajokull) shut down European airspace for 6 days â€” costing airlines $1.3 billion and stranding 10 million passengers
info: Iceland is a Nordic island nation of fire and ice â€” active volcanoes, geysers, and Northern Lights. Its 2010 volcanic eruption shut European airspace for 6 days. The world's oldest parliament (Althing) was founded here in 930 AD.

name: India
landmark: Taj Mahal, Red Fort, Ganges River
knownEvent: Became world's most populous country 2023 surpassing China, Moon landing Chandrayaan-3 2023, G20 host 2023
viralFact: In 2023 India surpassed China to become the world's most populous country with 1.4 billion people â€” and landed a spacecraft near the Moon's south pole, becoming only the 4th country to land on the Moon
info: India surpassed China in 2023 to become the world's most populous country. Home to the Taj Mahal, Bollywood, and a successful Moon landing (Chandrayaan-3) near the lunar south pole in 2023.

name: Indonesia
knownEvent: 2004 Boxing Day Tsunami killed 230,000, 1997 Asian financial crisis, moving capital to Nusantara
viralFact: Indonesia is moving its entire capital city from Jakarta (sinking into the sea) to a new city called Nusantara in Borneo â€” the largest capital relocation project in history
info: Indonesia is the world's largest archipelago nation (17,000+ islands), 4th most populous country, and home to Bali and Komodo dragons. It's moving its entire capital to Borneo due to Jakarta sinking.

name: Iran
knownEvent: 1979 Islamic Revolution, nuclear program sanctions, Mahsa Amini protests 2022
viralFact: The 2022 'Woman Life Freedom' protests in Iran â€” sparked by the death of Mahsa Amini in morality police custody â€” became one of the most significant women's rights uprisings of the 21st century
info: Iran (ancient Persia) is a Middle Eastern theocracy with the world's largest Shia Muslim population. The 2022 'Woman Life Freedom' protests after Mahsa Amini's death became a landmark global movement.

name: Iraq
knownEvent: US invasion 2003, Saddam Hussein executed, ISIS caliphate 2014-2019
viralFact: Iraq is home to Mesopotamia â€” the 'Cradle of Civilization' where writing, the wheel, and the first cities were invented over 5,000 years ago
info: Iraq is home to Mesopotamia, the cradle of civilization where writing was invented. It was invaded by the US in 2003 after Saddam Hussein's regime, then suffered the ISIS caliphate from 2014-2019.

name: Israel
knownEvent: Hamas October 7 2023 attack, Israel-Gaza war 2023-2024, founded 1948
viralFact: The Hamas attack on Israel on October 7, 2023 â€” killing 1,200 people â€” was Israel's deadliest day since the Holocaust and triggered the most destructive war in Gaza's history
info: Israel is a Middle Eastern Jewish state founded in 1948, home to Jerusalem's holy sites for three major religions. The October 7, 2023 Hamas attack and resulting Gaza war dominated global news in 2023-2024.

name: Italy
landmark: Colosseum, Leaning Tower of Pisa, Venice canals, Vatican City
knownEvent: Vatican City is inside Italy, won 4 World Cups, COVID hit hardest in 2020
viralFact: Italy was the first Western country devastated by COVID-19 in early 2020 â€” images of empty St. Peter's Square and military trucks carrying coffins shocked the world
info: Italy is the birthplace of the Roman Empire, Renaissance art, pizza, and the Vatican. It contains two independent states (Vatican City and San Marino) and was the first Western nation devastated by COVID-19 in 2020.

name: Jamaica
knownEvent: Birthplace of reggae and Bob Marley, Usain Bolt world records
viralFact: Usain Bolt from Jamaica is the fastest human ever recorded â€” running 100m in 9.58 seconds in 2009, a world record that still stands today
info: Jamaica is a Caribbean island nation that punches far above its weight â€” birthplace of reggae music, Bob Marley, and Usain Bolt (world's fastest human ever). Despite being tiny, it dominates Olympic sprinting.

name: Japan
landmark: Mount Fuji, Tokyo Tower, Hiroshima Peace Memorial
knownEvent: Atomic bombs 1945, 2011 Fukushima nuclear disaster and tsunami, Tokyo 2020 Olympics
viralFact: The 2011 Japan earthquake (9.0 magnitude) triggered a tsunami that caused the Fukushima nuclear disaster â€” the worst nuclear accident since Chernobyl â€” yet Japan rebuilt within years
info: Japan is an island nation of ancient traditions and cutting-edge technology, the only country to suffer atomic bombings (1945), and site of the 2011 Fukushima nuclear disaster. Home to anime, sushi, and Mount Fuji.

name: Jordan
knownEvent: Petra used in Indiana Jones, hosts millions of Syrian refugees
viralFact: Jordan's ancient city of Petra â€” carved into rose-red rock â€” was voted one of the New Seven Wonders of the World and appeared in Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
info: Jordan is a Middle Eastern monarchy home to Petra (a New Seven Wonder carved in rose rock), the Dead Sea (lowest point on Earth), and Wadi Rum desert used in The Martian and Lawrence of Arabia films.

name: Kazakhstan
knownEvent: Borat film made it famous/infamous, Baikonur launches first satellite and human to space, 2022 protests
viralFact: Sputnik and Yuri Gagarin both launched from Kazakhstan's Baikonur Cosmodrome â€” the site where the Space Age began in 1957 and 1961
info: Kazakhstan is the world's largest landlocked country, spanning Central Asia and Europe. Baikonur Cosmodrome here launched Sputnik and Yuri Gagarin into space. The Borat film controversially made it famous worldwide.

name: Kenya
landmark: Maasai Mara, Mount Kenya, Great Rift Valley
knownEvent: Eliud Kipchoge first human to run marathon under 2 hours 2019, 2024 anti-tax protests
viralFact: Eliud Kipchoge from Kenya ran a marathon in 1:59:40 in 2019 â€” becoming the first human to break the 2-hour barrier, one of sport's greatest achievements
info: Kenya is East Africa's economic hub, home to the Maasai Mara wildebeest migration and Eliud Kipchoge â€” who became the first human to run a marathon in under 2 hours in 2019.

name: Kuwait
knownEvent: Iraq invaded Kuwait 1990, Gulf War 1991, Kuwaiti dinar = world's highest currency
viralFact: The Kuwaiti Dinar is the world's highest-valued currency â€” 1 KWD = approximately $3.25 USD, making it more valuable than any other currency on Earth
info: Kuwait is a tiny oil-rich Gulf monarchy whose currency (Kuwaiti Dinar) is the world's most valuable. Iraq invaded Kuwait in 1990, triggering the Gulf War and US-led liberation in 1991.

name: Laos
knownEvent: Most bombed country per capita in history (US Vietnam War era), Plain of Jars mystery
viralFact: Laos is the most heavily bombed country per capita in history â€” the US dropped more bombs on Laos during the Vietnam War era than were used in all of WWII combined
info: Laos is the only landlocked country in Southeast Asia and the most heavily bombed nation per capita in history, due to US bombing during the Vietnam War era. Still governed by a Communist party.

name: Latvia
knownEvent: Human chain Baltic Way 1989 â€” 2 million people formed a chain across Estonia-Latvia-Lithuania to demand Soviet independence
viralFact: In 1989 nearly 2 million people across Latvia, Lithuania, and Estonia held hands in a 675 km human chain called 'The Baltic Way' â€” one of the most powerful peaceful protests in history
info: Latvia is the middle Baltic state â€” between Estonia and Lithuania â€” an EU and NATO member with capital Riga, famous for Art Nouveau architecture. Its language (Latvian) is one of the oldest living languages in Europe.

name: Lebanon
landmark: Baalbek Roman ruins, Cedars of Lebanon
knownEvent: Beirut port explosion 2020 â€” one of the largest non-nuclear explosions in history
viralFact: The 2020 Beirut port explosion was so powerful it was felt in Cyprus 240km away â€” 2,750 tonnes of ammonium nitrate detonated, killing 218 people and destroying half the city
info: Lebanon is a tiny Middle Eastern country whose capital Beirut was devastated by a catastrophic port explosion in 2020 â€” one of the largest non-nuclear blasts in history. It has the region's only significant Christian minority government.

name: Libya
knownEvent: Gaddafi ruled 42 years, Arab Spring 2011 led to his killing, open slave markets discovered 2017
viralFact: In 2017 CNN footage revealed open-air slave markets operating in Libya â€” migrants trying to reach Europe were being auctioned for $400, sparking global outrage
info: Libya is a vast North African desert country that fell into chaos after Muammar Gaddafi's 42-year rule ended in the 2011 Arab Spring. CNN's 2017 exposure of slave markets there caused international outrage.

name: Lithuania
landmark: Vilnius Old Town, Hill of Crosses
knownEvent: First Soviet republic to declare independence 1990, Hill of Crosses pilgrimage site, Baltic Way 1989
viralFact: Lithuania was the first Soviet republic to declare independence in 1990 â€” Moscow sent tanks but Lithuania held firm, inspiring all other Soviet republics to follow
info: Lithuania is the southernmost and largest Baltic state, the first Soviet republic to declare independence (1990), and famous for basketball â€” it's been called 'the second religion' there. Capital is Vilnius.

name: Luxembourg
knownEvent: EU founding member, world's highest GDP per capita, first country to offer free public transport nationwide
viralFact: Luxembourg has the world's highest GDP per capita â€” citizens earn more per head than any other country. In 2020 it became the first country to make ALL public transport free
info: Luxembourg is the world's only Grand Duchy and has the highest GDP per capita globally. An EU founding member, it became the first country to make all public transport free in 2020. Entirely landlocked between France, Germany, and Belgium.

name: Madagascar
knownEvent: 90% endemic wildlife found nowhere else on Earth, DreamWorks Madagascar film
viralFact: Over 90% of Madagascar's wildlife exists nowhere else on Earth â€” it separated from Africa 165 million years ago, creating a completely unique ecosystem with lemurs found only here
info: Madagascar is the world's fourth-largest island off Africa's coast, with 90% of its wildlife found nowhere else on Earth. Lemurs are unique to Madagascar, and the DreamWorks film made it globally famous.

name: Malaysia
knownEvent: MH370 disappeared 2014 â€” greatest aviation mystery ever, MH17 shot down over Ukraine 2014
viralFact: Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 disappeared on March 8, 2014 with 239 people aboard â€” it has never been found, making it the greatest aviation mystery in history
info: Malaysia is a Southeast Asian nation famous for the Petronas Twin Towers and the mysterious disappearance of flight MH370 in 2014 â€” the greatest unsolved aviation mystery, with the aircraft never found.

name: Malta
landmark: Valletta (EU's smallest capital), Megalithic temples older than Stonehenge
knownEvent: WWII George Cross â€” most bombed place in WWII, Game of Thrones filming location
viralFact: Malta's megalithic temples (3600 BC) are older than both Stonehenge and the Egyptian pyramids â€” making Malta home to the world's oldest free-standing stone structures
info: Malta is a tiny Mediterranean island EU member with megalithic temples older than the pyramids. The only EU member where Maltese (a Semitic language written in Latin script) is spoken. Valletta is the EU's smallest capital city.

name: Mexico
knownEvent: Drug cartel wars, Chichen Itza New Wonder, 1985 earthquake, 2017 earthquake
viralFact: Mexico City is sinking into the ground at 50cm per year â€” built on an ancient lakebed, it's one of the fastest-sinking cities in the world
info: Mexico is the largest Spanish-speaking country, home to Aztec ruins, Chichen Itza (a New Seven Wonder), and struggling with powerful drug cartels. Mexico City is sinking 50cm per year into ancient lakebed sediment.

name: Moldova
knownEvent: Poorest country in Europe, Transnistria breakaway region backed by Russia, pro-EU turn 2024
viralFact: Moldova has a breakaway region called Transnistria â€” a Soviet-era frozen state with its own currency, army, and government, backed by Russian troops, that most of the world doesn't recognize
info: Moldova is Europe's poorest country, landlocked between Romania and Ukraine. It contains Transnistria â€” a pro-Russian breakaway state with Russian troops that hasn't been internationally recognized since 1990.

name: Mongolia
knownEvent: Genghis Khan built largest contiguous land empire in history, nomadic culture
viralFact: Genghis Khan's Mongol Empire was the largest contiguous land empire in history â€” at its peak it covered 24 million kmÂ², roughly 22% of Earth's total land area
info: Mongolia is the world's most sparsely populated country, homeland of Genghis Khan who built history's largest contiguous empire. The Gobi Desert covers much of the south, and traditional nomadic life still thrives.

name: Morocco
landmark: Sahara Desert, Marrakech medina, Atlas Mountains
knownEvent: 2022 World Cup semifinal â€” first African and Arab nation to reach World Cup semis, 2023 earthquake
viralFact: Morocco became the first African and Arab nation to reach a FIFA World Cup semifinal in 2022 â€” their run in Qatar united the entire Arab world in celebration
info: Morocco is a North African kingdom with coastlines on both the Atlantic and Mediterranean. It made history in 2022 as the first African/Arab nation to reach a World Cup semifinal, and suffered a devastating earthquake in 2023.

name: Mozambique
knownEvent: Civil war ended 1992, Cyclone Idai 2019 one of worst Southern Hemisphere storms ever
viralFact: Cyclone Idai hit Mozambique in 2019 creating an 'inland ocean' â€” floodwaters covered an area the size of Luxembourg, affecting 3 million people in one of Africa's worst natural disasters
info: Mozambique is a Portuguese-speaking southern African nation devastated by Cyclone Idai in 2019 â€” one of Africa's worst natural disasters ever. It has some of the world's best coral reef diving.

name: Myanmar
knownEvent: Military coup 2021 ousted Aung San Suu Kyi, Rohingya genocide, formerly called Burma
viralFact: Myanmar's military coup in 2021 sparked a mass civil disobedience movement â€” doctors, teachers, and railway workers all went on strike, and thousands of young people joined armed resistance groups
info: Myanmar (formerly Burma) had its fragile democracy crushed by a military coup in 2021. The Rohingya genocide and ongoing civil war have made it one of the world's worst humanitarian crises. Home to thousands of ancient Bagan temples.

name: Nepal
knownEvent: Home of Mount Everest, 2015 earthquake killed 9,000, Nirmal Purja climbed all 14 peaks over 8000m in 6 months 2019
viralFact: Nirmal Purja (Nepali climber) summited all 14 mountains above 8,000m in just 6 months and 6 days in 2019 â€” the previous record was 7 years and 310 days
info: Nepal is a landlocked Himalayan kingdom home to Mount Everest â€” the world's highest peak. Nepali climber Nirmal Purja shattered records by climbing all 14 eight-thousanders in just 6 months in 2019.

name: Netherlands
landmark: Windmills, tulip fields, Anne Frank House Amsterdam
knownEvent: MH17 shot down over Ukraine 2014 killing 196 Dutch citizens, Anne Frank hid here WWII
viralFact: The Netherlands is 26% below sea level â€” without its 3,500 km of dikes and flood barriers, two-thirds of the country would be permanently underwater
info: The Netherlands ('Holland') has 26% of its land below sea level, protected by the world's most advanced flood management system. Famous for tulips, windmills, Anne Frank, and the most bicycles per capita on Earth.

name: New Zealand
knownEvent: Christchurch mosque shooting 2019, PM Ardern global response, Lord of the Rings filmed here
viralFact: New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern's response to the 2019 Christchurch terror attack â€” refusing to name the shooter and wearing hijab in solidarity â€” was praised globally as a model of compassionate leadership
info: New Zealand is a Pacific island nation famous for Lord of the Rings filming locations, All Blacks rugby, and PM Jacinda Ardern's globally admired leadership after the 2019 Christchurch mosque terror attack.

name: Nigeria
knownEvent: Africa's most populous nation, Boko Haram kidnapped 276 schoolgirls 2014 (Chibok), Nollywood = world's 2nd largest film industry
viralFact: Nollywood (Nigeria's film industry) produces more films per year than Hollywood â€” it's the world's second-largest film industry by volume, making Nigeria the entertainment capital of Africa
info: Nigeria is Africa's most populous country (220 million+) and largest economy. Nollywood produces more films than Hollywood. The 2014 Boko Haram kidnapping of 276 Chibok schoolgirls sparked the global #BringBackOurGirls campaign.

name: North Korea
knownEvent: Nuclear weapons tests, Kim Jong-un, defectors stories, sending troops to Russia 2024
viralFact: North Korea sent 10,000+ soldiers to fight for Russia in Ukraine in 2024 â€” the first time North Korean troops have fought in a foreign war, shocking the international community
info: North Korea is the world's most isolated nation, ruled by the Kim dynasty since 1948. It has nuclear weapons and in 2024 shocked the world by sending over 10,000 soldiers to fight alongside Russia in Ukraine.

name: North Macedonia
knownEvent: Name dispute with Greece resolved 2019 â€” was called FYROM for 27 years, birthplace of Mother Teresa
viralFact: North Macedonia spent 27 years in a bizarre name dispute with Greece â€” it was officially called 'Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia' (FYROM) because Greece objected to the name 'Macedonia'
info: North Macedonia is a landlocked Balkan nation that spent 27 years in a name dispute with Greece (called FYROM). It claims Alexander the Great as a national hero, is birthplace of Mother Teresa, and has Lake Ohrid â€” one of Europe's oldest lakes.

name: Norway
knownEvent: Nobel Peace Prize awarded in Oslo, richest sovereign wealth fund in world, UtÃ¸ya massacre 2011
viralFact: Norway's sovereign wealth fund (Government Pension Fund) is worth over $1.7 trillion â€” the world's largest, giving every Norwegian citizen virtual ownership of nearly $300,000
info: Norway is a Scandinavian monarchy with the world's most valuable sovereign wealth fund ($1.7 trillion from oil revenue). Famous for fjords, the Northern Lights, and awarding the Nobel Peace Prize in Oslo.

name: Oman
knownEvent: Sultan Qaboos ruled 50 years modernizing Oman, neutral diplomacy role in Middle East
viralFact: Oman is the only Muslim-majority country that follows Ibadi Islam â€” an ancient sect that predates both Sunni and Shia, practiced by only 2% of Muslims worldwide
info: Oman is a Gulf monarchy unique for following Ibadi Islam â€” the oldest Islamic sect, practiced by only 2% of Muslims. Under Sultan Qaboos (50-year reign), Oman transformed from a medieval state to a modern nation and plays a neutral diplomatic role.

name: Pakistan
knownEvent: Osama Bin Laden found and killed in Pakistan 2011, Malala Yousafzai, Imran Khan arrested 2023
viralFact: Osama Bin Laden was found living in a compound in Abbottabad, Pakistan â€” just 1km from the country's top military academy â€” for years before US Navy SEALs killed him in 2011
info: Pakistan is a nuclear-armed South Asian nation of 230+ million. Osama Bin Laden was found hiding near its top military academy in 2011. Home to K2 (world's 2nd highest peak) and Nobel Peace laureate Malala Yousafzai.

name: Panama
knownEvent: Panama Papers 2016 exposed world leaders hiding money, Panama Canal links Atlantic and Pacific
viralFact: The 2016 Panama Papers leak exposed 11.5 million documents showing how world leaders, billionaires, and celebrities hid trillions in offshore accounts â€” the largest data leak in history at the time
info: Panama is a Central American country whose canal connects the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans. The 2016 Panama Papers leak â€” exposing offshore tax havens of world leaders â€” was the largest journalistic data leak ever.

name: Paraguay
landmark: Itaipu Dam â€” world's largest hydroelectric power station
knownEvent: Itaipu Dam produces 90% of Paraguay's electricity, harbored Nazi war criminals post-WWII
viralFact: Paraguay is the only country in South America where an indigenous language (GuaranÃ­) is spoken by the majority of the population alongside Spanish â€” a unique bilingual culture
info: Paraguay is a landlocked South American nation where GuaranÃ­ â€” an indigenous language â€” is spoken by the majority alongside Spanish. The Itaipu Dam on its border produces one of the world's largest amounts of hydroelectric power.

name: Peru
landmark: Machu Picchu, Nazca Lines, Amazon River source
knownEvent: Machu Picchu New Seven Wonder, Amazon River starts here, political instability 2020s
viralFact: The Amazon River â€” carrying more water than the next 7 largest rivers combined â€” has its source in Peru. Peru also contains the mysterious Nazca Lines: giant geoglyphs only visible from the air
info: Peru is home to Machu Picchu (New Seven Wonder), the Nazca Lines, and the source of the Amazon River. The ancient Inca Empire was centered here before Spanish conquest in the 16th century.

name: Philippines
landmark: Chocolate Hills Bohol, Puerto Princesa underground river
knownEvent: Typhoon Haiyan 2013 deadliest storm ever to make landfall, Duterte drug war, 7,641 islands
viralFact: Typhoon Haiyan (2013) was the strongest tropical cyclone ever recorded at landfall â€” with winds of 315 km/h, it killed 6,300 people and displaced 4 million in the Philippines
info: The Philippines is a Southeast Asian archipelago of 7,641 islands and the only predominantly Catholic country in Asia. Hit by Typhoon Haiyan in 2013 â€” the strongest storm ever to make landfall â€” killing over 6,300 people.

name: Poland
landmark: Auschwitz-Birkenau, Warsaw Old Town, Wieliczka Salt Mine
knownEvent: WWII started here 1939, Auschwitz Holocaust, Solidarity movement ended Communism, hosts NATO troops 2022+
viralFact: Poland was the first country invaded in WWII (1939) and lost 6 million citizens â€” 17% of its population â€” the highest percentage loss of any country in the war
info: Poland was the first country invaded in WWII (1939) and suffered the highest percentage population loss of any nation. Home to Auschwitz, Warsaw's rebuilt Old Town (a UNESCO miracle), and Marie Curie.

name: Portugal
knownEvent: Vasco da Gama discovered sea route to India, Cristiano Ronaldo, Eurovision 2018
viralFact: Portugal once had the world's largest empire â€” at its peak stretching from Brazil to Mozambique to Macau, covering 10% of the Earth's land. Portuguese is now spoken by 250 million people worldwide
info: Portugal is the westernmost country in mainland Europe and once controlled the world's largest empire. Vasco da Gama sailed from here to discover the sea route to India. Home to Cristiano Ronaldo and the fado music tradition.

name: Qatar
knownEvent: Hosted FIFA World Cup 2022 â€” first in Middle East and first in winter, Al Jazeera media network
viralFact: Qatar has the world's highest GDP per capita and hosted the 2022 World Cup in air-conditioned stadiums â€” some workers built them in 50Â°C heat, with thousands dying in controversial construction conditions
info: Qatar is a tiny Gulf peninsula with the world's highest GDP per capita from vast gas reserves. It hosted the 2022 FIFA World Cup â€” the first in the Middle East and first in winter â€” amid controversies over worker conditions.

name: Romania
landmark: Dracula's Bran Castle, Transylvania, Painted Monasteries
knownEvent: Ceausescu executed Christmas Day 1989 â€” televised revolution, Dracula legend from Transylvania, Nadia Comaneci perfect 10
viralFact: Romania's 1989 revolution was the only violent revolution in Eastern Europe's fall of Communism â€” dictator Nicolae Ceausescu was tried and executed on live TV on Christmas Day
info: Romania is an Eastern European EU member famous for Transylvania (Dracula's homeland), gymnast Nadia Comaneci's perfect 10, and its Communist dictator Ceausescu being executed on live TV on Christmas Day 1989.

name: Russia
landmark: Red Square, Kremlin, St Basil's Cathedral, Lake Baikal
knownEvent: Invaded Ukraine 2022 â€” largest European war since WWII, Putin, Navalny death 2024, Soviet space race
viralFact: Russia's 2022 invasion of Ukraine â€” ordering troops to cross the border on February 24 â€” triggered the largest ground war in Europe since WWII and reshuffled the entire global order
info: Russia is the world's largest country spanning 11 time zones. Its 2022 full-scale invasion of Ukraine triggered the largest European war since WWII, sweeping global sanctions, and the death of opposition leader Alexei Navalny in prison in 2024.

name: Saudi Arabia
knownEvent: Khashoggi murder 2018, Vision 2030 MBS reforms, women allowed to drive 2018, LIV Golf
viralFact: Saudi Arabia allowed women to drive only in 2018 â€” making it the last country in the world to grant women this right. The same year journalist Jamal Khashoggi was murdered inside its Istanbul consulate.
info: Saudi Arabia is the birthplace of Islam and home to Mecca and Medina â€” the two holiest cities in Islam. It only allowed women to drive in 2018 and the 2018 murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi caused a global diplomatic crisis.

name: Senegal
landmark: Goree Island slave house, Pink Lake
knownEvent: Africa Cup of Nations winner 2021, 2022 first West African country to reach World Cup quarters, Dakar Rally
viralFact: Senegal is the westernmost point of mainland Africa and the last stop of the transatlantic slave trade â€” GorÃ©e Island was the departure point for millions of enslaved Africans to the Americas
info: Senegal is the westernmost country in mainland Africa. GorÃ©e Island was a major departure point in the transatlantic slave trade. Senegal won its first Africa Cup of Nations in 2021 and reached the 2022 World Cup quarterfinals.

name: Serbia
knownEvent: Yugoslav Wars, NATO bombing 1999, birthplace of Nikola Tesla, Novak Djokovic
viralFact: Nikola Tesla â€” inventor of AC electricity, the radio, and the Tesla coil â€” was born in Serbia. Without his inventions, modern civilization as we know it would not exist.
info: Serbia is a landlocked Balkan nation, birthplace of Nikola Tesla (inventor of AC electricity) and tennis legend Novak Djokovic. It does not recognize Kosovo's independence and is not an EU or NATO member.

name: Singapore
landmark: Marina Bay Sands, Gardens by the Bay, Changi Airport
knownEvent: Trump-Kim summit 2018, consistently world's best airport, Crazy Rich Asians film
viralFact: Singapore's Changi Airport has been voted the world's best airport for 12 consecutive years â€” it has a butterfly garden, a waterfall, a cinema, and a rooftop pool inside the terminal
info: Singapore is a tiny city-state island that transformed from a fishing village to one of the world's richest nations in one generation. Changi Airport has been voted the world's best for 12 years running. The Trump-Kim summit was held here in 2018.

name: Slovakia
knownEvent: Split from Czech Republic 1993 Velvet Divorce, PM Fico assassination attempt 2024
viralFact: Slovakia's Prime Minister Robert Fico was shot five times in May 2024 â€” the first assassination attempt on a European leader in decades, shocking the continent
info: Slovakia peacefully split from Czech Republic in 1993 ('Velvet Divorce'). Its PM Robert Fico survived an assassination attempt in 2024. Bratislava is one of the few capitals that borders two other countries (Austria and Hungary).

name: Slovenia
knownEvent: First Yugoslav republic to leave Yugoslavia 1991 (10-day war), birthplace of Melania Trump
viralFact: Slovenia gained independence from Yugoslavia in just a 10-day war in 1991 â€” the shortest war of Yugoslav dissolution. It is also the birthplace of Melania Trump, former US First Lady.
info: Slovenia is a tiny Alpine EU and NATO member that left Yugoslavia in a 10-day war in 1991. Famous for the fairy-tale Lake Bled and as the birthplace of Melania Trump. One of the wealthiest former Yugoslav states.

name: South Africa
landmark: Table Mountain, Cape of Good Hope, Robben Island
knownEvent: Apartheid ended 1994, Nelson Mandela, hosted 2010 World Cup, Elon Musk born here
viralFact: South Africa is the only country to have voluntarily dismantled its own nuclear weapons program â€” it built 6 nuclear bombs during apartheid and then destroyed them all in 1989
info: South Africa dismantled its own nuclear weapons in 1989 â€” the only country ever to do so. It ended apartheid in 1994 under Nelson Mandela, hosted the 2010 World Cup, and is birthplace of Elon Musk. It has 11 official languages.

name: South Korea
knownEvent: BTS and K-pop global phenomenon, Squid Game Netflix 2021, 2002 World Cup co-host, martial law declared 2024
viralFact: In December 2024 South Korea's President Yoon declared martial law â€” the first in 44 years â€” only to have it voted down by parliament within 6 hours in a dramatic overnight constitutional crisis
info: South Korea is the birthplace of K-pop, BTS, Samsung, and Squid Game. In 2024 its president declared martial law for 6 hours before parliament voted it down. The DMZ border with North Korea is the most heavily fortified border on Earth.

name: Spain
knownEvent: Won 2010 World Cup, La Liga (Real Madrid vs Barcelona), running of the bulls Pamplona
viralFact: Spain's Sagrada Familia church in Barcelona has been under construction since 1882 â€” it is still not finished and is the longest-running construction project in modern history, expected to complete in 2026
info: Spain is Western Europe's largest country by area, famous for La Liga football, flamenco, and the Sagrada Familia â€” a church under construction since 1882. Won the 2010 World Cup and has Real Madrid and Barcelona, the world's biggest football clubs.

name: Sri Lanka
landmark: Sigiriya Lion Rock, Temple of the Tooth
knownEvent: Economic collapse 2022 â€” president fled as protesters stormed palace, 2004 tsunami, civil war ended 2009
viralFact: In 2022 Sri Lanka went completely bankrupt â€” it ran out of fuel, medicine, and food. Tens of thousands stormed the presidential palace and swam in its pool, forcing the president to flee the country
info: Sri Lanka is an island nation off India's southern tip, famous for tea and the 2022 total economic collapse where citizens stormed the presidential palace and the president fled the country.

name: Sudan
knownEvent: Darfur genocide 2003, civil war 2023, split from South Sudan 2011
viralFact: Sudan has more ancient pyramids than Egypt â€” over 200 Nubian pyramids built by the Kushite kingdoms, yet they remain largely unknown to the outside world
info: Sudan has more ancient pyramids than Egypt â€” 200+ Nubian pyramids â€” yet remains largely overlooked. It suffered the Darfur genocide in 2003 and in 2023 erupted into one of Africa's worst civil wars.

name: Sweden
landmark: Stockholm archipelago, ABBA Museum, Vasa Ship Museum
knownEvent: Joined NATO 2024 ending 200 years of neutrality, Nobel Prize created here, Greta Thunberg, ABBA
viralFact: Sweden joined NATO in March 2024 â€” ending over 200 years of military non-alignment â€” the longest period of neutrality any country has ever maintained before joining a military alliance
info: Sweden joined NATO in 2024, ending 200+ years of neutrality â€” the longest in history. Home to ABBA, IKEA, Spotify, Volvo, and climate activist Greta Thunberg. The Nobel Prizes (except Peace) are awarded in Stockholm.

name: Switzerland
knownEvent: Permanently neutral since 1815, CERN discovered Higgs boson 2012, Roger Federer, World Economic Forum Davos
viralFact: Switzerland has been officially neutral in every war since 1815 â€” it didn't join the United Nations until 2002, making it one of the last countries to do so, to protect its neutrality
info: Switzerland has been permanently neutral since 1815 and didn't even join the UN until 2002. Home to CERN (where the Higgs boson was discovered), the World Economic Forum in Davos, and the world's best chocolate and watches.

name: Syria
landmark: Ancient city of Damascus, Palmyra ruins
knownEvent: Civil war 2011-2024, Assad regime fell December 2024, worst refugee crisis since WWII
viralFact: In December 2024 Syrian rebels captured Damascus in 11 days, ending 54 years of Assad family rule â€” Bashar al-Assad fled to Russia, shocking the entire world
info: Syria had a devastating civil war (2011-2024) that created the worst refugee crisis since WWII â€” 13 million displaced. In December 2024, rebels captured Damascus in 11 days and Assad fled to Russia, ending 54 years of family rule.

name: Taiwan
knownEvent: Makes 90% of world's advanced chips (TSMC), China claims it as its own, geopolitical flashpoint
viralFact: Taiwan's TSMC makes over 90% of the world's most advanced semiconductor chips â€” every iPhone, AI chip, and modern computer depends on Taiwan. If China invaded, the global tech industry would collapse.
colonialHistory: Japanese colony, then Republic of China
info: Taiwan makes 90% of the world's most advanced semiconductor chips through TSMC â€” making it the most geopolitically important island on Earth. China claims sovereignty over Taiwan, creating a potential flashpoint for global conflict.

name: Tanzania
knownEvent: Mount Kilimanjaro â€” Africa's highest peak, Serengeti migration, Olduvai Gorge human origins
viralFact: The Serengeti's annual wildebeest migration â€” 1.5 million animals moving in a giant circle â€” is the largest animal migration on Earth and one of the greatest wildlife spectacles ever
info: Tanzania is home to Mount Kilimanjaro (Africa's highest peak), the Serengeti's 1.5 million wildebeest migration, and Zanzibar's spice islands. Olduvai Gorge here is where some of the earliest human fossils were found.

name: Thailand
landmark: Grand Palace Bangkok, Phi Phi Islands, Chiang Mai temples
knownEvent: 2018 Tham Luang cave rescue â€” 12 boys rescued from flooded cave after 17 days, only SE Asian country never colonized
viralFact: The 2018 Thailand cave rescue â€” 12 boys and their football coach trapped 4km inside a flooded cave for 17 days â€” was watched by 1 billion people worldwide and became a global miracle story
info: Thailand is the only Southeast Asian country never colonized by Europeans. The 2018 Tham Luang cave rescue â€” 12 trapped boys rescued after 17 days â€” was watched by a billion people globally. Famous for Buddhist temples, street food, and beaches.

name: Turkey
knownEvent: 2023 earthquake killed 50,000, Hagia Sophia reconverted to mosque 2020, straddles Europe and Asia
viralFact: Turkey's February 2023 earthquake (7.8 magnitude) killed over 50,000 people and destroyed 160,000 buildings â€” it was the deadliest earthquake in Europe and the Middle East in over 20 years
info: Turkey straddles Europe and Asia, with Istanbul the only city in the world on two continents. The 2023 earthquake killed 50,000 people. Hagia Sophia â€” built in 537 AD as a church, converted to mosque in 1453, then museum, then mosque again in 2020.

name: Uganda
landmark: Mountain gorillas, Source of the Nile
knownEvent: Idi Amin dictatorship, source of River Nile, mountain gorilla conservation
viralFact: Half of the world's remaining mountain gorillas live in Uganda â€” there are fewer than 1,000 left on Earth, making gorilla trekking in Uganda one of the most exclusive wildlife experiences
info: Uganda contains the source of the Nile River and is home to half the world's remaining mountain gorillas. Dictator Idi Amin's brutal 1970s reign made it internationally infamous. The Nile flows northward 6,650 km to Egypt from here.

name: Ukraine
landmark: Kyiv St Sophia Cathedral, Chernobyl exclusion zone
knownEvent: Russia invaded 2022 â€” largest European war since WWII, Zelensky, Chernobyl 1986 nuclear disaster
viralFact: Ukraine's President Zelensky was a comedian and actor before becoming president â€” he played the president on a TV show before actually becoming one, then led his country's resistance against Russia's 2022 invasion
info: Ukraine is the largest country entirely within Europe. Russia's 2022 full-scale invasion triggered the biggest European war since WWII. President Zelensky was a comedian who played a president on TV before actually becoming one.

name: United Arab Emirates
landmark: Burj Khalifa, Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Marina
knownEvent: Burj Khalifa tallest building ever, Dubai turned desert into luxury city, Expo 2020
viralFact: The Burj Khalifa in Dubai at 828 metres is so tall that you can watch the sunset from the ground floor, take the elevator to the top, and watch the sunset again â€” because you are above the curvature of Earth
info: The UAE is a federation of 7 emirates including Dubai and Abu Dhabi. The Burj Khalifa is the world's tallest building at 828m. The UAE transformed from desert to global luxury destination in one generation using oil wealth.

name: United Kingdom
landmark: Big Ben, Buckingham Palace, Stonehenge, Tower of London
knownEvent: Brexit 2020, Queen Elizabeth II died 2022, invented football, industrial revolution
viralFact: Queen Elizabeth II's death in September 2022 after 70 years on the throne triggered the world's largest ever state funeral â€” watched by 4.1 billion people globally, the most-watched event in television history
info: The UK was the world's largest empire, invented football, sparked the Industrial Revolution, and left the EU in 2020 (Brexit). Queen Elizabeth II's 2022 funeral was watched by 4.1 billion people â€” the most-watched event in TV history.

name: United States
landmark: Statue of Liberty, Grand Canyon, White House, Hollywood
knownEvent: 9/11 2001, Moon landing 1969, Trump presidency 2025, COVID origin controversy
viralFact: The United States is the only country to have landed humans on the Moon â€” 12 astronauts walked on the lunar surface between 1969 and 1972, a feat no other country has yet repeated
info: The United States is the world's largest economy and only country to land humans on the Moon (1969-1972). It has the most Nobel Prize winners, most Hollywood films, and remains the dominant global superpower. Trump returned to presidency in 2025.

name: Uruguay
knownEvent: First country to fully legalize cannabis 2013, hosted first ever World Cup 1930, most progressive country in South America
viralFact: Uruguay was the first country in the world to fully legalize cannabis for recreational use in 2013 â€” you could buy government-regulated marijuana at pharmacies
info: Uruguay hosted the first ever FIFA World Cup in 1930 and won it. In 2013 it became the first country to fully legalize recreational cannabis. Despite being small, it's consistently ranked South America's most progressive and stable democracy.

name: Uzbekistan
knownEvent: Timur (Tamerlane) empire, Silk Road trade center, Aral Sea ecological disaster
viralFact: The Aral Sea â€” once the world's 4th largest lake â€” almost completely disappeared due to Soviet-era irrigation projects. Uzbekistan now has rusting ship graveyards in the middle of a desert where a sea used to be
info: Uzbekistan is a Central Asian nation at the heart of the ancient Silk Road, with spectacular Timurid architecture in Samarkand. The Aral Sea â€” once one of the world's largest lakes â€” dried up due to Soviet irrigation, leaving ship graveyards in a desert.

name: Venezuela
landmark: Angel Falls â€” world's highest waterfall
knownEvent: Economic collapse under Maduro, 7 million refugees fled â€” largest migration crisis in Americas, highest oil reserves in world
viralFact: Venezuela has the world's largest proven oil reserves â€” yet 7 million people fled the country due to economic collapse, making it the largest migration crisis in the Western Hemisphere's history
info: Venezuela has the world's largest proven oil reserves yet collapsed economically under Maduro's government â€” 7 million people fled, creating the Americas' worst refugee crisis. Home to Angel Falls, the world's highest waterfall.

name: Vietnam
landmark: Ha Long Bay, Hoi An ancient town, Phong Nha caves
knownEvent: Vietnam War 1955-1975, US defeated, fastest growing economy in SE Asia, world's largest cave Son Doong
viralFact: Vietnam defeated three superpowers in the 20th century â€” France (1954), the United States (1975), and China (1979) â€” making it one of the most militarily resilient nations in history
info: Vietnam defeated France, the United States, and China in the 20th century â€” a feat no other nation achieved. Now one of Asia's fastest-growing economies, it contains Son Doong â€” the world's largest cave, large enough to contain a skyscraper.

name: Yemen
landmark: Old City of Sanaa, Socotra Island
knownEvent: Worst humanitarian crisis in world 2015-present, Houthi attacks on Red Sea shipping 2023-2024
viralFact: Yemen's Houthi rebels attacked over 100 commercial ships in the Red Sea in 2023-2024 â€” disrupting 15% of global trade and forcing ships to reroute around Africa, adding weeks to journeys
info: Yemen has been called the world's worst humanitarian crisis since 2015 â€” a devastating civil war with Saudi Arabia and Iran backing opposing sides. Houthi rebels attacked Red Sea shipping in 2023-2024, disrupting global trade.

name: Zambia
knownEvent: Victoria Falls â€” largest waterfall curtain in the world, copper mining economy
viralFact: Victoria Falls on the Zambia-Zimbabwe border is the world's largest waterfall by total area â€” the spray can be seen 50km away and the local name 'Mosi-oa-Tunya' means 'The Smoke That Thunders'
info: Zambia is a landlocked southern African nation sharing Victoria Falls with Zimbabwe â€” the world's largest waterfall whose spray is visible 50km away. Its economy depends heavily on copper mining.

name: Zimbabwe
knownEvent: Mugabe 37-year rule, worst hyperinflation in history 2008 (100 trillion dollar note), Victoria Falls
viralFact: Zimbabwe's 2008 hyperinflation reached 89.7 sextillion percent â€” the government printed a 100 trillion dollar note that couldn't buy a bus ticket. It's the most extreme case of hyperinflation in modern history.
info: Zimbabwe is famous for the worst hyperinflation in modern history â€” in 2008 it printed a 100 trillion dollar note that was worthless. Robert Mugabe ruled for 37 years. It shares Victoria Falls with Zambia and has 16 official languages.
